title: Hummus with Pureed Sesame Seeds (No Pre-made Tahini Here!)Spinach With Sesame Seed
directions: Drain chick pea liquid directly into a blender or food processor.
Add the sesame seeds and garlic to the blender, cover, and puree until smooth (3-4 min.).
Add chick peas, lemon juice, salt, and oil (if using) to blender.
Cover and mix until well blended, stopping and scraping down sides of bowl occasionally.
Pour into a serving dish and garnish with chopped parsley (if using).
Serve with pita chips or wedges.
In a large saucepan cook spinach in 2 cups boiling water for 2 minutes; drain and rinse in cold water.
Chop spinach coarsely and set aside in a deep serving dish.
In a small skillet over high heat toast sesame seed until light brown (2-3 minutes)and then sesame seed to a mortar and crush with pestle.
Stir in soy sauce and sugar.
Toss sesame seed mixture with spinach and serve.
ingredients: 2 cloves garlic, peeled and cut in half (or more to taste)
1 teaspoon olive oil or 1 teaspoon vegetable oil (optional)
